maml:description.maml:para: Convert from OS build number to OS version
Convert from OS build number to OS version associated with build. Note that "OS version" is not the same as "OS release version"

dev:type.maml:name: None, you can't p to ConvertFrom-OSBuild

maml:description.maml:para: Method to get broadcast addresses on local machine
Return multiple broadcast addresses, for each configured adapter. This includes both physical and virtual adapters. Returned broadcast addresses are only for IPv4

maml:Description.maml:para: Include all possible adapter types present on target computer
Include all possible adapter types present on target computer

dev:type.maml:name: None. You cannot pipe objects to Get-Broadcast
None. You cannot pipe objects to Get-ComputerName
[string] computer name in form of COMPUTERNAME

maml:alert.maml:para: TODO: implement querying computers on network by specifying IP address

maml:description.maml:para: Return list of all configured adapters and their configuration. Applies to adapters which have an IP assigned regardless if connected to network. This conditionally includes virtual and hidden adapters such as Hyper-V adapters on all compartments.

maml:Description.maml:para: IP version for which to obtain adapters, IPv4 or IPv6
Include all possible adapter types present on target computer
IP version for which to obtain adapters, IPv4 or IPv6
IP version for which to obtain adapters, IPv4 or IPv6
Include all possible adapter types present on target computer

dev:type.maml:name: None. You cannot pipe objects to Get-ConfiguredAdapter
[NetIPConfiguration] or error message if no adapter configured

maml:alert.maml:para: TODO: Loopback interface is missing in the output

maml:description.maml:para: Method to get aliases of configured adapters

Return list of interface aliases of all configured adapters. Applies to adapters which have an IP assigned regardless if connected to network. This may include virtual adapters as well such as Hyper-V adapters on all compartments.

maml:Description.maml:para: IP version for which to obtain adapters, IPv4 or IPv6
Include all possible adapter types present on target computer
IP version for which to obtain adapters, IPv4 or IPv6
IP version for which to obtain adapters, IPv4 or IPv6
Include all possible adapter types present on target computer

dev:type.maml:name: None. You cannot pipe objects to Get-InterfaceAlias

maml:description.maml:para: Method to get list of IP addresses on local machine
Returns list of IPAddress objects for all configured adapters. This could include both physical and virtual adapters.

maml:Description.maml:para: IP version for which to obtain address, IPv4 or IPv6
Include all possible adapter types present on target computer
IP version for which to obtain address, IPv4 or IPv6
IP version for which to obtain address, IPv4 or IPv6
Include all possible adapter types present on target computer

dev:type.maml:name: None. You cannot pipe objects to Get-IPAddress
[IPAddress[]] Array of IP addresses and warning message if no adapter connected

maml:description.maml:para: Get the SKU (Stock Keeping Unit) information for one or multiple target computers, or translate SKU number to SKU

maml:Description.maml:para: Operating system SKU number, can't be used with ComputerName parameter
One or more computer names, can't be used with SKU parameter
Operating system SKU number, can't be used with ComputerName parameter
One or more computer names, can't be used with SKU parameter

dev:type.maml:name: None. You cannot pipe objects to Get-SystemSKU

maml:description.maml:para: Test target computer (policy store) on which to apply firewall

The purpose of this function is to reduce typing checks depending on whether PowerShell core or desktop edition is used, since parameters for Test-Connection are not the same for both PowerShell editions.

maml:Description.maml:para: Valid only for PowerShell Core. Specifies the number of echo requests to send. The default value is 4
Valid only for PowerShell Core. The test fails if a response isn't received before the timeout expires
Valid only for PowerShell Core. Specifies the number of echo requests to send. The default value is 4
Valid only for PowerShell Core. The test fails if a response isn't received before the timeout expires

dev:type.maml:name: None. You cannot pipe objects to Test-TargetMachine
[bool] false or true if target host is responsive
